programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Charlie Ross and the teams are in Shropshire. Experts Charles Hanson and Ben Cooper lead the reds and blues as they compete for bargains at an antiques fair in Oswestry. Meanwhile, Charlie visits a family firm in Llangollen who are crafting wood to make standing frames for people with spinal injuries.

programme.title: The Bidding Room
programme.desc: Five dealers bid to buy a ride-on train and a rugby shirt from a famous film.

programme.title: Take a Hike
programme.desc: Mischievous musician Innes's 8km mountain walk starts with a climb over the lower ridges of Bruach na Frithe in the Cullin range, before following a meandering river with its myriad pools through the Glen of Sligachan. The landscape inspired a lockdown album for Innes with its dramatic views of the mountains and the loch below, so will its inspirational views be enough to bag the big prize? But there may be a be a swarm of tiny problems. It's midge season on Skye, and the boggy terrain of the Glen of Sligachan is heaven for the flying insects - so will it be trouble in paradise as they threaten to wreak havoc?

programme.title: 24/7 Pet Hospital
programme.desc: Black labrador Bilko is referred to the hospital, as he's had an extreme allergic reaction. Despite treatment by his vet, he appears to be getting worse. Initially stable overnight, he takes a turn for the worse, and his heart rate means staff must monitor him closely. Attempts to anaesthetise Bilko for a scan cause further concern, and the team call in cardiologist Brian to treat him urgently. In the consulting room, a Belgian Malinois named Hope arrives with her owners after a huge mystery lump has appeared on her throat. Surgeon Anna investigates. In the neurology department, they're also looking for answers. Roxy the dachshund is shaking so badly that she is unable to walk. The team come together for solutions.

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A suivre, les dernières actualités présentées par les équipes rédactionnelles de la BBC, le très réputé radiodiffuseur du service public britannique. Créée en 1922 à Londres, la British Broadcast Corporation est connue pour être la plus ancienne société diffusant des programmes de radio ou de télévision au monde.

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A suivre, les dernières actualités présentées par les équipes rédactionnelles de la BBC, le très réputé radiodiffuseur du service public britannique. Créée en 1922 à Londres, la British Broadcast Corporation est connue pour être la plus ancienne société diffusant des programmes de radio ou de télévision au monde.

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts a general knowledge quiz featuring the greatest quiz team in Britain.

programme.title: The Hairy Bikers' Pubs That Built Britain
programme.desc: Si and Dave are in the West Country, sampling local cider.

programme.title: Earth's Great Rivers
programme.desc: Le fleuve Amazone est un monde secret, qui abrite l'anguille électrique géante, la loutre géante, des sources d'eaux chaudes et un récif méconnu, à l'embouchure du fleuve.

programme.title: My Unique B&B
programme.desc: Saison 2 Episode 13 In Monmouthshire, Simon and his team take on a 1980s bus conversion. Année de réalisation : 2022

programme.title: Your Home Made Perfect
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Flog It !
programme.desc: Flog It! comes from Glemham Hall in the Suffolk countryside, which dates back to the Tudor era. Antiques expert David Fletcher discovers some scripts from the television series Lovejoy, which featured a Suffolk antique dealer, and Jonathan Pratt spots some Beatles bobbing-head dolls designed to fit in a car. Paul Martin follows in the footsteps of local composer Benjamin Britten.

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Kaye Adams, Mark Chapman, Philip Glenister and Thanyia Moore face more trivia questions.

programme.title: B&B By the Sea
programme.desc: It's the turn of actor Adam Woodyatt to check into the B&B.

programme.title: Jay's Yorkshire Workshop
programme.desc: Jay Blades' workshop makes furniture to thank a mental health mentor and a youth worker.

programme.title: Banjo: Designing the Hebrides
programme.desc: Banjo has been commissioned by fish shop manager and friend Sally, who wants to modernise her family's traditional business in Tobermory. Banjo has bold plans to utterly transform both the inside and outside of the shop, but Sally is worried that her family will disapprove of the radical makeover. With his band of trusty locals, including Eoghann the carpenter and handyman Tom, Banjo takes huge risks in realising his design ambitions - but how will the family feel about the new look?

programme.title: Wales' Home of the Year
programme.desc: The search is on for Wales's Home of the Year 2022. The judges are led by Wales's favourite drumming weatherman Owain Wyn Evans. He joins interior designer Mandy Watkins from Anglesey, and Cardiff-based architect Glen Thomas to discover outstanding homes across Wales. The judges visit the north east and must choose between a Grade II listed manor house near Mold, a Victorian terrace in Buckley and a Gothic revival cottage outside Wrexham. Scoring them on architectural merit, distinctive design and original style, which home will Owain, Mandy and Glen judge worthy enough to go forward to the grand final?

programme.title: Saving Lives in Leeds
programme.desc: Neurosurgeon Ryan Mathew performs awake brain surgery on a patient with a large tumour.

programme.title: Detectorists
programme.desc: Saison 3 Episode 1 Lance's flat isn't his own any more and Andy's staying with the mother-in-law. But at least they have their old faithful permission to escape. Or do they? The dark cloud of a solar farm threatens the tranquillity. Année de réalisation : 2017

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: In-depth news and current affairs review of the main political and economic stories of the day, featuring robust interviews with senior government and opposition figures, business and trade union leaders.

programme.title: Stronger
programme.desc: En 2013, Erin Hurley se lance un défi : celui de faire le marathon de Boston. Elle est soutenue par son petit ami Jeff Bauman. Le 13 avril, la course se déroule sans encombres mais, quand Erin s'apprête à franchir la ligne d'arrivée, une bombe explose. Jeff fait partie des victimes. A l'hôpital, alors qu'il est entre la vie et la mort, les médecins ne peuvent sauver ses jambes. A peine sorti du bloc, le jeune homme fait une description du poseur de bombe au FBI. Il devient un héros malgré lui. Ne sachant que faire de cette notoriété, il se bat pour oublier la douleur et tente de vivre sa vie de couple avec son handicap... Année de réalisation : 2017

programme.title: Saving Lives in Leeds
programme.desc: At Leeds Children's Hospital, liver surgeon Naved Alizai must treat two urgent patients.

programme.title: Saved and Remade
programme.desc: Expert crafters transform an old sideboard and an ornate clock into stunning new items.

programme.title: Saved and Remade
programme.desc: A beloved gramophone and a treasured slide projector are among today's transformations.

programme.title: This is BBC Two
programme.desc: This is BBC Two.
